frame.definition: The base unit of time measurement in the game, equal to 1/60th of a second. All move properties are measured in frames.

startup.definition: The number of frames from the input of an attack until the first active frame. The move cannot hit during this phase.

active.definition: The number of frames during which an attack's hitbox is present and can connect with an opponent.

recovery.definition: The number of frames after the last active frame, during which the character is returning to a neutral state and is unable to act.
